intro: Alsinanthus grandiflorus, commonly known as the largeflowered alsin, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant produces showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Alsinanthus grandiflorus is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
